metadata.title: CVE-2018-17456 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Git before 2.14.5, 2.15.x before 2.15.3, 2.16.x before 2.16.5, 2.17.xbefore 2.17.2, 2.18.x before 2.18.1, and 2.19.x before 2.19.1 allows remotecode execution during processing of a recursive "git clone" of asuperproject if a .gitmodules file has a URL field beginning with a '-'character.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
git-all - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
git-cvs - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
git-daemon-run - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
git-el - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
git-email - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
git-gui - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
git-man - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
git-mediawiki - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
git-svn - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
gitk - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
gitweb - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.3').
